head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Gardens ¶ 17/1/66 ¶ ¶ I Hereby beg to propose Gerhard Krefft Esq. Director of the Museum of Sydney, for a Fellowship of the Linnean Society. Mr Krefft is personally known to me as an e...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Certificates of Fellows, foreign members and associates 1865-1870.

I Hereby beg to propose Gerhard Krefft Esq. Director of the Museum of Sydney, for a Fellowship of the Linnean Society. Mr Krefft is personally known to me as an excellent naturalist & acquired celebrity for his researches into the zoological treasures of New South Wales.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
F.L.S.
MS annotation, front: Proposed, April 19, 1866 | Ballot, Novr 1, 1866. | Elected Rd. K.
Kreft was formally proposed on 19 April 1866 on a MS certificate in Richard Kippist’s (?) hand, signed ‘Ferdinand Müller (by letter) | Geo Busk | Fredk Currey | Geo Macleay’. He was described as ‘Gerhard Krefft, Esqr, Correspg Member Zool. Soc,, &c, Director of the Australian Museum Sydney, … and an excellent Zoological Observer’.
